page.title: 15A Local Newspaper
page.content: The Advertiser is a{free newspaper which delivers 84,957 copies into Tameside homes. It has 56 pages and is paid for by{advertisements. The main stories in the paper for 27th June 1985 were about an ex-wife who tried to hire someone to kill her husband, and a man who raised Â£200 for the Baby Unit at Tameside Hospital by letting people shave off his hair. Inside we read about an old lady who thought that two men were helping her,but when she wasn't looking they stole Â£3000. A man wrote a letter to the paper about Hyde saying it now looks dirty and old. A picture showed some policemen in our area riding push-bikes again to get around.In a story about primary education we read about our science work and the French that will be taught in all Tameside primary schools from September.
